subtitle: Baby’s got constipation
title: Worried Mom
content:
My baby is 4 months old. Since he was born he has chronic constipation. Sometimes it’s more than 10 days between two motions. It’s been 4 days since he’s passed stool the last time. And the wind he passes smells very bad. He doesn’t want to drink milk either. Sometimes I have to feed him only when he’s asleep. I only give him breast-milk. He’s also got runny nose for the last 2 weeks. He doesn’t have fever or cough though. My poor baby! He must have been feeling so bad .I feel so helpless. As a mother what to do now? Should I give him something to relieve constipation? How can I treat his runny nose?

What to do for this? 

**APONJON HELP: If he doesn’t pass stool for next 2 days you can use glycerin suppository. Sometimes constipation is caused by underlying medical condition or birth defect. You should consult a pediatrician to rule this out.
For runny nose you can give your baby antihistamine syrup. Keep the nostrils clean by wiping with wet cotton.**
